Article/0-0-0-18/server-request-and-resp.title: Server request and response
Article/0-0-0-18/server-request-and-resp.html:
The server key<\/a><\/h2>

The server key is a proxy around the Express<\/a> instance that runs Nullstack under the hood.<\/p>

The server object is present only in the server<\/em> context.<\/p>

The following functions are tunneled back to the Express server:<\/p>

  • get<\/code><\/li>
  • post<\/code><\/li>
  • put<\/code><\/li>
  • patch<\/code><\/li>
  • delete<\/code><\/li>
  • options<\/code><\/li>
  • head<\/code><\/li>
  • use<\/code><\/li> <\/ul>

    ✨ If you wanna know how to make an API with Nullstack, this is the way.<\/p> <\/blockquote> 

    // server.js<\/span>
import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> Application from<\/span> './src/Application'<\/span>;<\/span>

const<\/span> context =<\/span> Nullstack.<\/span>start<\/span>(<\/span>Application)<\/span>;<\/span>

context.<\/span>server.<\/span>get<\/span>(<\/span>'/api/books'<\/span>,<\/span> (<\/span>request,<\/span> response<\/span>)<\/span> =><\/span> {<\/span>
  response.<\/span>json<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>books<\/span>:<\/span> [<\/span>]<\/span>}<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
}<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> context;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

    Other available keys are:<\/p>

      

    • port<\/strong>: integer<\/code><\/li>

    • maximumPayloadSize<\/strong>: string<\/code><\/li>
<\/ul>

      // server.js<\/span>
import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> Application from<\/span> './src/Application'<\/span>;<\/span>

const<\/span> context =<\/span> Nullstack.<\/span>start<\/span>(<\/span>Application)<\/span>;<\/span>

const<\/span> {<\/span> server }<\/span> =<\/span> context;<\/span>
server.<\/span>port =<\/span> 3000<\/span>;<\/span>
server.<\/span>maximumPayloadSize =<\/span> '5mb'<\/span>;<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> context;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

      Request and Response<\/a><\/h2>
      Every server function context is merged with the original request<\/code> and response<\/code> objects from Express.<\/p>

      If you raise a response manually it will override the framework's server-side rendering<\/a> response<\/code>.<\/p>

      import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Application<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  static<\/span> async<\/span> getBooks<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>request,<\/span> response}<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    if<\/span>(<\/span>!<\/span>request.<\/span>session.<\/span>user)<\/span> {<\/span>
      response.<\/span>status<\/span>(<\/span>401<\/span>)<\/span>.<\/span>json<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>unauthorized<\/span>:<\/span> true<\/span>}<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
    }<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  // ...<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Application;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

      It's also possible to expose server functions from your components to be in the web API. Instead of using a function that a request<\/code> and a response<\/code> pass the static function from your component to the express route.<\/p>

      // server.js<\/span>
import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> Application from<\/span> './src/Application'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> WaifuComponent from<\/span> './src/WaifuComponent'<\/span>;<\/span>

const<\/span> context =<\/span> Nullstack.<\/span>start<\/span>(<\/span>Application)<\/span>;<\/span>

context.<\/span>server.<\/span>get<\/span>(<\/span>'/waifus'<\/span>,<\/span> WaifuComponent.<\/span>getWaifus)<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> context;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>
